@nalanpog The work they did was on stabilizing the spike protein. They've shown (through cryo-EM) that it is. The question of whether that spike in a mRNA platform protects people against covid is only possible to test, as we are currently doing, because of the previous research.
Right now, everyone in the scientific world is trying to get into the coronavirus field, published papers of dubious quality keep seeing the light of day.

“People generally at that time said, ‘Coronavirus is not a big concern,’ ” Nianshuang Wang said. “They didn’t get the idea that this can be a great technology in the future, to prevent another coronavirus pandemic.”

This is just a detail in this story - that I think applies to our ability to recognize novel and important findings, ideas, voices, etc.
